Title: Object: The Flight into Egypt
Description: The Flight into Egypt, after Domenichino; the Holy Family approaching from the right, with a mule, on the bank of a river, with a ferry boat on the right, nearing the bank, a pyramid and small temple with a triangular pediment among the trees on the far bank and two figures on the shore; with completed production details and crest. 1767 Etching and engraving
Curator's comments: See Spear p.324, who identifies the painting as one sold from Downton in 1979, but rejects the attribution to Domenichino (it was sold in 1979 as G.F.Grimaldi).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca
